required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study Of CP-690,550 In Stable Kidney Transplant Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 1, Placebo-controlled, Randomized, Sequential, Parallel-group, Dose Escalation Study to Evaluate 28-day Multiple Dose Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of CP-690,550 in Stable Renal Allograft Recipients

brief_summary.textblock: This was a Phase 1 dose escalation study to evaluate the safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetics of 28-day treatment of CP-690,550 in stable renal allograft recipients. In Stage 1, ascending doses of CP-690,550 were to be administered sequentially to 3-4 cohorts of subjects. After Stage 1, one dose level was to be selected for dosing in an expanded cohort in Stage 2.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast) For CP-690,550
primary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration time-curve from zero to the last measured concentration (AUClast).

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast) at Steady State For CP-690,550
primary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration time-curve from zero to the last measured concentration (AUClast) at steady state.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to 12 Hour Concentration [AUC(0-12)] at Steady State For CP-690,550
primary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration time-curve from zero to 12 hour concentration [AUC(0-12)] at steady state.

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) For CP-690,550
Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) at Steady State For CP-690,550
Time to Reach Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Tmax) For CP-690,550
Time to Reach Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Tmax) at Steady State For CP-690,550
Accumulation Ratio (Rac) For CP-690,550
primary_outcome.description: Rac obtained from AUC(0-12) (Day 29) divided by AUC(0-12) (Day 1).

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma Decay Half-Life (t1/2) For CP-690,550
primary_outcome.description: Plasma decay half-life is the time measured for the plasma concentration to decrease by one half.

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma Decay Half-Life (t1/2) at Steady State For CP-690,550
primary_outcome.description: Plasma decay half-life is the time measured for the plasma concentration to decrease by one half at steady state.

primary_outcome.measure: Mycophenolic Acid (MPA) Plasma Trough Concentration at Baseline
primary_outcome.description: Pro-drug MMF was metabolically converted to active form MPA in the liver. The baseline for MPA trough concentrations was defined as the average of the values obtained at Screening and on Day 1 (pre-dose). MPA levels were assessed at different visits to assess change in MPA trough levels due to CP-690,550 exposure.

primary_outcome.measure: Mycophenolic Acid (MPA) Plasma Trough Concentration at Day 8
primary_outcome.description: Pro-drug MMF was metabolically converted to active form MPA in the liver. MPA levels were assessed at different visits to assess change in MPA trough levels due to CP-690,550 exposure.

primary_outcome.description: Pro-drug MMF was metabolically converted to active form MPA in the liver. MPA levels were assessed at different visits to assess change in MPA trough levels due to CP-690,550 exposure.

primary_outcome.description: Pro-drug MMF was metabolically converted to active form MPA in the liver. MPA levels were assessed at different visits to assess change in MPA trough levels due to CP-690,550 exposure.

primary_outcome.description: CsA levels were assessed at different visits to assess change in CsA trough levels due to CP-690,550 exposure.

intervention.description: Placebo tables twice daily (BID) for 28 days

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Medically stable kidney transplant patients 6 or more months after transplantation.
- Subjects must be on mycophenolate mofetil 1-2 gm daily
- In Cohort 3 (and 4, if conducted) in Stage 1 and the expanded cohort in Stage 2, subjects must be on a calcineurin inhibitor-free regimen.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any rejection episodes in the preceding 3 months.
- Treated with Thymoglobulin or OKT3 for acute rejection in the past 6 months.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

group.title: Placebo, Stage 1
group.description: Placebo matched to CP-690,550 tablet orally twice daily up to Day 28 followed by single oral dose on Day 29 in stable renal transplant recipients, receiving maintenance immunosuppression therapy (mycophenolate mofetil [MMF] with or without calcineurin inhibitor [cyclosporine {CsA} or tacrolimus {TAC}]) as per local clinical practice in Stage 1.

group.title: CP-690,550 5 mg, Stage 1
group.description: CP-690,550 5 milligram (mg) tablet orally twice daily up to Day 28 followed by single oral dose on Day 29 in stable renal transplant recipients, receiving maintenance immunosuppression therapy (MMF), calcineurin inhibitor (CsA) as per local clinical practice in Stage 1.

group.title: CP-690,550 15 mg, Stage 1
group.description: CP-690,550 15 mg tablet orally twice daily up to Day 28 followed by single oral dose on Day 29 in stable renal transplant recipients, receiving maintenance immunosuppression therapy (MMF), calcineurin inhibitor (CsA or TAC) as per local clinical practice in Stage 1.

group.description: CP-690,550 30 mg tablet orally twice daily up to Day 28 followed by single oral dose on Day 29 in stable renal transplant recipients, receiving maintenance immunosuppression therapy (MMF) as per local clinical practice in Stage 1.

measure.title: Mycophenolic Acid (MPA) Plasma Trough Concentration at Day 15
measure.description: Pro-drug MMF was metabolically converted to active form MPA in the liver. MPA levels were assessed at different visits to assess change in MPA trough levels due to CP-690,550 exposure.
measure.population: Analysis population included all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study treatment.

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
